{{quote|There must have been a mighty crowd of dwarves here at one time and every one of them busier than badgers for five hundred years to make all this, and most in hard rock too!|[[Samwise Gamgee]]<ref name=FRII4/>}}

'''Badgers''' were known in the [[Westlands]] for being excellent hole-diggers.<ref name=FRII4>{{FR|II4}}</ref> [[Men]] used traps to catch these animals.<ref>{{TT|III7}}</ref> 

A mysterious kind of apparently sentient badgers, only told of in legends, were called the [[Badger-folk]].<ref>{{AB|1}}</ref> Indeed, [[Tom Bombadil]] told to [[Frodo Baggins]] and his companions some absurd stories about the queer ways of badgers.<ref>{{FR|I7}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==

'''1982-97: ''[[Middle-earth Role Playing]]'':'''
: Badgers (which are given game statistics) are carnivorous animals of the fauna of Rhovanion. They are timid but can be dangerous if cornered.<ref>{{ICE|2016}}, p. 149</ref>

'''2002-5: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game]]'':'''
: Badgers (which are given game statistics) can be find in the Shire and throughout Eriador.<ref>{{D|Fell}}, p. 56</ref>
